page.title: 12ASTLEY CASTLE
page.content: This building is now in ruins following a recent fire.It is part of the Arbury Estate but has been used by others as the Newdigates didn't need another residence so close to Arbury. The castles most recent job was as a hotel,being used for army billets in W.W II. The building stands 50m N.E. of the church.It has a moated bailey,the remains of curtain walls,with a main building on the west side of the courtyard facing S.E.The bailey is 50m by 70m,the moat is 6m wide,the water being 3m deep,although the banks are between 3 & 4.5m deep.
